abstract: Yale University reports its endowment is now $25.4 billion and has earned 3.4 percent for fiscal year ending June 30; earning counters peer performance, which is averaging 2.7 percent loss; fund's success is credited to leader David Swensen, pioneer of investment model that includes other categories besides stocks and bonds.
lead_paragraph: The average return among endowments that have reported so far is a loss of 2.7 percent, according to Cambridge Associates.
snippet: The average return among endowments that have reported so far is a loss of 2.7 percent, according to Cambridge Associates....

headline.main: Yale Endowment Earned 3.4% in a Year When Many Peers Lost
headline.print_headline: Yale Endowment Shines vs. Returns for Its Peers
